data.event: In the year 220 BC., Matala was occupied by the Gortynians, and during the Roman period, Matala became the port of Gortys.
In the 1st and 2nd centuries, the caves were used as tombs.
In the 1960s, the caves were occupied by hippies who were later driven out by the church and the military junta.
Canadian folk singer Joni Mitchell's experiences with the Matala hippies were immortalised in her 1971 song "Carey".
